module.p: The definite article is a determiner.

section.p: The definite article can take a demonstrative pronoun as a modifier.

li.gd: A bheil an seòmar seo blàth?
A bheil an cù seo luath?

section.p: Like other determiners, a form of the definite article functions as the pre-specifier of a common noun.

Some examples –
nominative –
masculine –
Tha an cù dubh ach tha an cat bàn.
The dog is black but the cat is white. td. 6
A bheil an cù aig an dorus?
Is the dog at the door? td. 11
Tha an t-uisge ann.
It is raining. td. 12
A bheil an latha fuar?
Is the day cold? td. 14
Càit a bheil an gille beag an diugh?
Where is the little boy today? td. 14
A bheil an seòmar seo blàth?
Is this room warm? td. 14
Càit a bheil an gual?
Where is the coal? td. 15 [227]
Tha an duine anns a’ bhàta.
The man is in the boat. td. 17
Tha am bàta air a’ chladach.
The boat is on the shore. td. 17
feminine
A bheil an sgoil mór?
Is the school big? td. 14
Tha a’ chaileag beag.
The girl is small. td. 15
plural
dative –
masculine –
Tha an cù aig an dorus agus tha an cat aig an teine.
The dog is at the door and the cat is by the fire. td. 6
Nach eil Calum anns an achadh?
Isn’t Malcolm in the field? td. 11
Tha Seònaid anns an taigh.
Janet is in the house. td. 14
Tha Seònaid a’ cluich air an làr.
Janet is playing on the floor. td. 14
A bheil an cù dubh anns an achadh còmhla ris an duine?
Is the black dog in the field along with the man? td. 15 [227]
Tha an duine anns a’ bhàta.
The man is in the boat. td. 17
Tha am bàta air a’ chladach.
The boat is on the shore. td. 17
Tha an duine anns a’ mhonadh leis a’ chù.
The man is on the moor with the dog. td. 19
feminine
Tha an gille beag anns an sgoil.
The little boy is in the school. td. 14
plural
